helpful, useful, or good: An increase in stock prices can be benefic to the value of the dollar, as can raising interest rates. Medical studies have shown the benefic effects of this drug regimen in patients with conditions as diverse as asthma, arthritis, and rheumatism.
More examplesFewer examplesAntioxidants are thought to have a benefic effect on the body, as studies show they help prevent heart disease and certain types of cancer. In astrology, Venus and Jupiter are thought to be benefic planets, while Mars and Saturn are not.
